task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 101°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: Failed to parse response, using fallback.
I still can’t reliably estimate height without a clear view of the roofline, so I should tilt up to include the top of the facade in frame.
I’m now looking north instead of east, so I should rotate right to face the building direction (~101°) while keeping the upward pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate height I need both the base and roofline in one view, so I should move a bit farther back to widen the framing of the building.
I’m facing north again, so I should rotate right to roughly east (~101°) to bring the target building back into view for height estimation.
Now that I’m facing the building again, I should tilt up to capture the roofline and estimate the number of stories for a height calculation.
I need to face the target building direction again (~101° east) while keeping the upward pitch, so I should rotate right about 101°.
I should stop rotating and directly estimate the building height from the visible facade by counting stories once I can see the top, so I’ll tilt up to include the roofline.
The view snapped back to north again, so I must rotate right to ~101° to face the target building while keeping pitch up for roof visibility.
Repeated pitch-up attempts aren’t persisting, so I should estimate from the current straight-on view by assuming a typical 3-story institutional building height.
